Posts.Content: Hi Your pains could be due to after effects of chemo I have the same problems in my joints and fingers I can't open packets and do buttons etc and if I walk too far my ankles knees and hips play up getting out of bed at night is fun too.  I am on letrozole not tamoxifen my gp has prescribed pregablin and 30mg codiene for pains which help a bit.  Lucky me my finger nails decided to come off this weekend this rollercoaster is so much fun. I would check with your oncologist just to make sure what is causing these annoying aches and pains Maxinem  I was told they can last for months so I will just take things a day at a time and fingers crossed things will get better
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen (for probably the millionth time)

Posts.Content: Hi maxinem I too get really stiff if I've sat down but if I've been active and sit down it gets ridiculous I can hardly move the same at night when go to toilet.  I have to remind myself to go for a wee as I can go all day without feeling the need also bowels playing up a bit too but I will not let the chemo biatch win lol no one said this rollercoaster was so much fun Keep strong cos were all gonna bear this  xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen (for probably the millionth time)

Posts.Content: Hi Was diagnosed with grade 3 Idc in December 2016 had 2 ops lymph node removal found in 3/20 chemo 3 EC 3 Docataxol had picc line fitted ended up in hospital with neutropenia sepsis and blood clot from picc line last chemo June 17 then 15 radiotherapy And letrozole for 10 years  Since last chemo had peripheral neuropathy and after starting letrozole bad joint pains am currently taking morning 300 mg pregablin 2.5mg apixaban and nighttime 300mg pregablin 30mg amitryptaline 60mg codiene 2.5 mg letrozole and 2.5mg apixaban  My gp sent me to pain management who have said to trial duloxetine. Is anyone else on this much medication  As the only plus I have at the moment is the amitryptaline is giving me a good sleep at night nothing really seems to be  helping lol thought after treatments finished I would bounce back but am still off work with no idea when I will be able to go back
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy joint pains and letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi I didn't stop my treatment but had EC and then t 3 of each The sickness is no where near as bad with the t hardly has to take any anti sickness with it  You get more joint pains with t but just take the pain killers they give you and do as your body tells you  Keep strong you will get good days in between treatments xx
